DOC.brief_summary: The Hintegra® Total Ankle Prosthesis is a non constrained, three-component prosthesis that consists of a flat tibial component, an anatomically-shaped talar component, and a high-density polyethylene inlay. The Hintegra ankle was specifically developed as an attempt to address the needs of minimal bone resection, extended bone support, proper ligament balancing, and minimal contact stressed within and around the prosthesis. The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the HINTEGRA® Total Ankle prosthesis at short and mid term follow up.
DOC.criteria: Patient implanted with an Hintegra® Total Ankle Prosthesis (only prosthesis designed with pegs) in primary ankle surgery since a minimum of 2 years Age ≥ 18 years Have willingness to give his/her data transfer authorisation History of prior mental illness or patient demonstrates that their mental capacity may interfere with their ability to follow the study protocol
